DOC.brief_summary: The objective test hypothesis luteal phase support vaginal progesterone lead high clinical pregnancy rate ( primary outcome ) live birth rate ( secondary outcome ) compare luteal phase support program intrauterine insemination ( IUI ) control ovarian stimulation gonadotrophin . Additionally , length luteal phase record ( secondary outcome ) order detect luteal phase defects/insufficiencies absence luteal phase suppletion well luteal phase prolongation case luteal phase support may burden patient wait outcome treatment .
DOC.criteria: Patients indication IUI : unexplained infertility mild male factor infertility minimalmild endometriosis Women : first IUI cycle ever normal ovulatory cycle ( 2632d ) age < 43 , BMI≤30 presence least one patent tube hysterosalpingography and/or laparoscopy normal uterine cavity ( ultrasound , hysterosalpingography , laparoscopy ) Men : Total motile count ≥ 5 Million/ml capacitation Patients contraindication pregnancy , infertility progesterone use .
